data.title: Music
data.meta_description: Terraria has over eighty music tracks across every version of the game. Each one will play and loop endlessly while the player is in a specific biome or while certain events are taking place. Music is individual to each player, and as such its volume can be lowered or disabled entirely within...
data.text:
# Title Condition Album Version Listen Description 1 Overworld Day Forest day Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Overworld_Day.mp3 It's a cheerful, upbeat, and simple tune that plays at day in a forest biome. 2 Eerie Meteorite, Blood Moon Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Eerie.mp3 It's slower and more sinister than most other tracks. At release, it also played in Corruption, Dungeon, and Underworld. 3 Overworld Night Forest and Hallow night Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Overworld_Night.mp3 It's relatively peaceful and relaxing, but its tune is a minor one. 4 Underground Cavern and Underground Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground.mp3 It's a fast and whimsical track, with an almost robotic tone. 5 Boss 1 Eater of Worlds, Eye of Cthulhu, King Slime, Skeletron, Skeletron Prime, Lepus, and Turkor Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Boss_1.mp3 Loud and frantic battle music. Also played for Duke Fishron before V1.4.0.1, and on Old-gen console and Windows Phone for the Goblin Army. 6 Title Screen Title screen Vol. 1 1.0 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Title_Screen.mp3 A serene, solemn tune, but short and hooking, this was played on the main menu before it was replaced with Journey's Beginning. It still plays in-game when the sun or moon is dragged. 7 Jungle Surface Jungle day Vol. 1 1.0.5 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Jungle.mp3 An exotic, relaxed tune, it has a unique feel to it with a heavy emphasis on percussion. 8 Corruption Surface Corruption Vol. 1 1.0.6 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Corruption.mp3 Its melody somewhat resembles the Overworld Day track but altered and slowed to sound much darker and more menacing. 9 The Hallow Surface Hallow day Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-The_Hallow.mp3 It has a very happy, heavenly tone and makes use of instruments related to this idea, especially the harp. It shares a lot of its melody with Overworld Day. 10 Underground Corruption Underground Corruption Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Corruption.mp3 This track is a combination of Corruption and Underground tracks, with a depressing and dark tone. 11 Underground Hallow Underground Hallow Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Hallow.mp3 This track is a combination of the Hallow and Underground tracks. It shares the heavenly tone of the Hallow tracks, but with a faster-paced, electronic tune. 12 Boss 2 Wall of Flesh, The Twins Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Boss_2.mp3 It's a very hectic, frantic tune, and gives the feel of a chase, fear and horror, especially at the beginning. 13 Boss 3 Brain of Cthulhu, Frost Legion, The Destroyer, The Torch God Vol. 1 1.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Boss_3.mp3 It's much slower and less intense than the other boss fights, the slowest track in the soundtrack, giving it a more menacing and mechanical tone, suiting most of the situations it plays in (e.g in the boss fights between Brain of Cthulhu and The Destroyer). 14 Ice/Snow Surface Snow biome Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Snow.mp3 A relaxed, somewhat slow-paced theme with a distinct, cold, and crystalline feel. Originally introduced on Old-gen console and Windows Phone as "Ice", it was later renamed "Snow" since the desktop version introduced its own "Ice" theme. 15 Space Night Space night Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Space_Night.mp3 A quick and carefree theme that makes use of many airy synths and shares some of its instruments with the Overworld Day theme. Contains a motif of Underground. 16 Crimson Surface Crimson Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Crimson.mp3 An unnerving, dark, and unsettling theme with a faster pace than that of the Corruption. Its main melody comes near the end of the track. 17 Golem/Boss 4 Golem, Lunatic Cultist

Pirate Invasion

Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Golem.mp3 Fast paced without being particularly dark or menacing. 18 Alternate Day Forest Day Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Alternate_Day.mp3 A cheerful, upbeat tune similar to the Overworld Day theme, but with a more complex composition. 19 Rain Surface Rain Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Rain.mp3 It gives the effect of a peaceful and calming theme, slower and less upbeat than others. 20 Ice/Underground Ice Ice biome Vol. 4 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Ice_biome.mp3 A calm, mysterious, and wintery theme slightly reminiscent of the Alternate Underground theme. 21 Desert Desert, Hallowed Desert night Vol. 4 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Desert.mp3 It is a simple, quiet theme inspired by ancient Egyptian music as commonly portrayed in other video games and films. Originally introduced on Old-gen console and Windows Phone. Replaced the Overworld Day theme in this biome. 22 Ocean Ocean day Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Ocean_Day.mp3 It is a tranquil theme with a somewhat slower pace than other daytime themes. 23 Dungeon Dungeon Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Dungeon.mp3 A sinister, dark theme that makes use of various instruments to evoke a sound akin to the echoes of a deep dungeon below. 24 Plantera Plantera Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Plantera.mp3 It is a unique, fast rock track with a metal tune and prominent use of electric guitars, and has some melodies from the Jungle soundtrack. As a nod to Cenx's favorite band, Pantera, parts of the track have a similar sound to the end "Domination" from the album Cowboys from Hell. 25 Queen Bee/Boss 5 Queen Bee, Ocram, Eye of Cthulhu Vol. 4 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Boss_5.mp3 It is a frenetic, serious theme, which uses sounds resembling bee buzzes and wing hovering. Originally introduced on Old-gen console and Windows Phone as "Boss 4", it was later renamed "Boss 5", since the PC version already had its own "Boss 4" theme. 26 Lihzahrd/Temple Temple Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Lihzahrd.mp3 A mysterious and exotic-sounding theme, feeling like being in an ancient world. 27 Eclipse Solar Eclipse Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Eclipse.mp3 It's dark with a varying pace, also featuring an organ to give it a classic horror/Halloween feel. Also played during Pumpkin Moon before v1.2.1.2. 28 Rain ambience Rain, Thunderstorm n/a 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:28_RainAmbience.wav The sounds of rain pattering on the ground with slight hints of distant thunder. 29 Mushrooms Glowing Mushroom biome Vol. 2 1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Mushrooms.mp3 An offbeat, exotic, twisty, and trippy piece. 30 Pumpkin Moon Pumpkin Moon Vol. 3 1.2.1.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Pumpkin_Moon.mp3 Spooky Halloween-themed music. Replaced the Eclipse theme for this event. 31 Alternate Underground Cavern and Underground Vol. 3 1.2.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Alternate_Underground.mp3 It has a different, less whimsical feel than the original Underground theme. It also contains a Boss 2 motif near the end of the song. 32 Frost Moon Frost Moon Vol. 3 1.2.2 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Frost_Moon.mp3 It vaguely resembles a Christmas song but is more upbeat and uses an electric guitar with a heavy distortion applied giving it a metal feel to the track. 33 Underground Crimson Underground Crimson Vol. 3 1.2.4 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Crimson.mp3 A mix of the Underground and Crimson tracks. 34 Lunar Boss/The Towers Lunar Events Vol. 2 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Lunar_Boss.mp3 A fast, abstract, and especially intense theme. Originally intended for the final boss, in the two years between the album's release and the introduction of the track in-game, plans had changed. Its album name would be used for the Moon Lord theme. 35 Pirate Invasion Pirate Invasion Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Pirate_Invasion.mp3 Somewhat reminiscent of the Pirates of the Caribbean soundtrack. Replaced the Golem/Boss 4 theme for this event. 36 Underworld The Underworld Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underworld.mp3 A deep and menacing track, with an emphasis on harsh percussion. Replaced Eerie theme for this biome. On the Nintendo 3DS version, this theme is replaced by Eerie. 37 Martian Madness Martian Madness Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Martian_Madness.mp3 A loud, daunting track. Originally released as a 1.3 spoiler.[1] 38 Moon Lord/Lunar Boss Moon Lord Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Moon_Lord.mp3 A unique, intense track with a fast tempo. Reuses part of the Lunar Towers and Space themes. Called "Lunar Boss" in-game. 39 Goblin Army/Goblin Invasion Goblin Army Vol. 3 1.3.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Goblin_Army.mp3 It somewhat vaguely resembles the Pumpkin Moon theme. Replaced "Boss 1" for this event. 40 Sandstorm Sandstorm Vol. 4 1.3.3 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Sandstorm.mp3 This track is a tense theme that uses a synth to simulate wind (along with actual wind sounds) as well as a sitar to give a sort of Egyptian desert feeling. Some parts of "Boss 5" and Lunar Event theme can be heard as well. 41 Old One's Army Old One's Army Vol. 4 1.3.4 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Old_One%27s_Army.mp3 An intense theme, more orchestral than most other Terraria songs, which incorporates bits from the the main theme of Dungeon Defenders as well as Terraria tracks Pirate Invasion, Title, Goblin Army, and Pumpkin Moon. 42 Space Day Space day Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Space_Day.mp3 It has a slower and calmer feeling. Originally introduced on Old-gen console and Windows Phone as "Space", before the PC version had its own Space theme added. On consoles, it serves as an alternate Space theme, both having a 50% chance of playing regardless of time. 43 Ocean Night Ocean night Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Ocean_Night.mp3 This track is more active and bouncier than its daytime counterpart. It has a happy, peaceful sounding tone. Originally introduced on Old-gen console and Windows Phone as "Ocean", before the PC version had its own Ocean theme added. On consoles, it serves as an alternate Ocean theme, both having a 50% chance of playing regardless of time. 44 Windy Day/High Wind Windy Day Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Windy_Day.mp3 A perky, cheerful, whimsical track, inspired by Winnie the Pooh[2]. It includes instruments such as music box, castanets and a tambourine, and is one of the few tracks in the game to not be in 4/4 time, rather it is in 3/4. 45 Wind Ambience Windy Day, Thunderstorm n/a 1.4.0.1 n/a The sounds of wind blowing past. 46 Town Day Town day Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Town_Day.mp3 A soothing track with a slight resemblance to Overworld Day. 47 Town Night Town night Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Town_Night.mp3 It starts quickly and then slows down to reveal a calm and enjoyable melody. 48 Slime Rain Slime Rain Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Slime_Rain.mp3 A bouncy, slightly silly-sounding track that plays during the event. It contains motifs of the Ocean Night and Underground themes. 49 Day Remix Music Box-only Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Contest_Winner.mp3 This Techno remix by Xenon and DSniper of the Overworld Day theme was the winning track of Terraria's music contest. 50 Journey's Beginning

(with intro) Title screen Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Journey%27s_Beginning_(intro).mp3 A triumphant, powerful track that plays on the title screen. On game launch and in the 1.4 trailer it features a ten-second-long "whoom" intro sound before looping into the standard Journey's Beginning track. It is also the first track to be heard by a new player. 51 Journey's Beginning Title screen n/a 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Journey%27s_Beginning.mp3 A triumphant, powerful track that plays on the title screen. Internally referred to as "Title Alt". 52 Storm Thunderstorm Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Storm.mp3 It sounds harsh and threatening, and has a slight resemblance to the Old One's Army and Sandstorm tracks. 53 Graveyard Graveyard Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Graveyard.mp3 A dark, depressing spin on the Town themes. 54 Underground Jungle Underground Jungle Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Jungle.mp3 Significantly less whimsical than the Surface Jungle tracks and sounds more threatening and melancholic. 55 Jungle Night Surface Jungle night Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Surface_Night_Jungle.mp3 It sounds very different from the day theme, with the main melody being a slow, ominous beat with an emphasis on deep drums. 56 Queen Slime Queen Slime Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Queen_Slime.mp3 This track begins with a regal and celebratory style, before turning into something more sinister and methodical. It contains a motif of Jungle Night. 57 Empress of Light Empress of Light Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Empress_of_Light.mp3 It begins as a fast, extremely intense track similar to Boss 2, before changing to a slower tune. The entire track has a very chaotic feel and sounds unlike anything else in Terraria. Uniquely, this track features a second loop with different composition, before completely looping. 58 Duke Fishron Duke Fishron Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Duke_Fishron.mp3 A slow theme with bubbling sounds and a pirate-like feel, in stark contrast with the fast-paced and chaotic fight it accompanies. 59 Tutorial/Morning Rain Morning Rain Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Morning_Rain.mp3 Very similar to the Overworld Day theme, but is significantly more extravagant and jolly, like one is about to embark on an adventure. Originally introduced on Old-gen console and Windows Phone as the "Tutorial" theme.

( PC version) During morning rain, this track is played only in normal forest biome, and it would be playing from 4:30 A.M. to 7:30 A.M.

60 Console Title/Alt Title Drunk world generation Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Title_(Console).mp3 An extended variation of the Title Screen track, with more instruments and expression. Originally introduced on Old-gen console and Windows Phone as the "Title Screen". 61 Underground Desert Underground Desert Vol. 4 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Desert.mp3 It begins as a slow, mysterious theme featuring strings and low tones, before it transitions into a rock-style theme, with guitars and heavy drums, similar to the Plantera track. 62 Rain (Otherworldly) Surface Rain and Thunderstorm Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Rain_(Otherworldly).mp3 An atmospheric track with light piano sounds that brings the image of falling rain. 63 Overworld Day (Otherworldly) Surface day Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Forest_Day_(Otherworldly).mp3 A celebratory, almost victoriously sounding track which features instruments like Irish flute for a fantasy feeling. 64 Night (Otherworldly) Surface night Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Forest_Night_(Otherworldly).mp3 It's an ominous, at times frantic track that gives a sense of impending danger. 65 Underground (Otherworldly) Cavern, Underground Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Main_Theme_(Underground)_(Otherworldly).mp3 A heroic-sounding track which features violin. Its internal name is "Music-Main Theme (Underground)" which suggests it was meant as a title screen track, which in turn fits with its grand intro. 66 Desert (Otherworldly) Desert, Underground Desert Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Desert_(Otherworldly).mp3 It begins with dobro (or similarly sounding instrument) for a Wild West-feeling, along with occasional heartbeats. It continues with Irish flute for a fantasy feeling, and ends with subtle female vocals. 67 Ocean (Otherworldly) Ocean Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Ocean_(Otherworldly).mp3 An ambient-like track which incorporates pan flute music to produce the image of distant shores. 68 Mushrooms (Otherworldly) Glowing Mushroom Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Crystal_Caves_(Mushrooms)_(Otherworldly).mp3 It resembles a more tranquil version of the regular mushroom biome track. Its internal name is "Music-Crystal Caves (Mushrooms)" which suggests it would also play in some Gemstone Cave-like biome. 69 Dungeon (Otherworldly) Dungeon, Temple Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Dungeon_(Otherworldly).mp3 It's a melancholic and ritualistic-feeling track which features chanting and tribal-like drums. 70 Space (Otherworldly) Space Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Space_(Otherworldly).mp3 An ambient track which subtly features 'psychedelic' sounds for a sci-fi feeling and gradually grows to a heroic sound. 71 Underworld (Otherworldly) Underworld Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underworld_(Otherworldly).mp3 Dark, aggressive, and features harpsichord music for a 'haunted house' feeling. 72 Snow (Otherworldly) Surface Snow Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Arctic_(Snow)_(Otherworldly).mp3 A calm track which shifts between what resembles uplifting trance music and fantasy music. 73 Corruption (Otherworldly) Surface Corruption Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Corruption_(Otherworldly).mp3 It's a dark, undulating track which features downtempo rock music. 74 Underground Corruption (Otherworldly) Underground Corruption Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Corruption_(Otherworldly).mp3 Resembles its Otherworld surface counterpart, but is somewhat more aggressive. 75 Crimson (Otherworldly) Surface Crimson Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Crimson_(Otherworldly).mp3 A dark, ambient track which seems to feature some type of contrabass brass instrument for a 'gloomy' feeling and eventually becomes almost psychedelic-sounding. 76 Underground Crimson (Otherworldly) Underground Crimson Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Crimson_(Otherworldly).mp3 A brooding and increasingly frantic track. 77 Ice (Otherworldly) Ice Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Ice_(Otherworldly).mp3 It has a "crystalline" and rather ominous sound to it. 78 Underground Hallow (Otherworldly) Underground Hallow Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Underground_Hallow_(Otherworldly).mp3 A sinister track that seems to involve different percussion instruments as well as a music box styled instrumentation to evoke a sense of sinister whimsy. 82 Invasion (Otherworldly) Frost Legion, Frost Moon, Goblin Army, Martian Madness, Old One's Army, Pirate Invasion, Pumpkin Moon Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Invasion_(Otherworldly).mp3 A menacing, "rapid" track which gives a sense of running out of time. 83 The Towers (Otherworldly) Lunar Events Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-The_Towers_(Otherworldly).mp3 Somewhat heroic-sounding, and features chanting as well as ample amounts of electric guitar. 84 Lunar Boss (Otherworldly) Moon Lord Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Lunar_Boss_(Otherworldly).mp3 Resembles The Towers track but has more chanting and feels even more dramatic, as is appropriate with the Moon Lord appearing after the Lunar Event. 85 Plantera (Otherworldly) Plantera Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Plantera_(Otherworldly).mp3 A metal-like track with a sinister and somewhat gloomy feeling, appropriate for the fight against Plantera in the Underground Jungle. 86 Jungle (Otherworldly) Jungle, Underground Jungle Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Jungle_(Otherworldly).mp3 A surprisingly tranquil track which seems to feature hurdy-gurdy music towards its end. The extended, enhanced version sold as part of the official Otherworld soundtrack is titled "Sky Guardian" (another name for the Wyvern) which suggests it was meant to play on Floating Islands or similar instead. 87 Wall of Flesh (Otherworldly) Wall of Flesh, The Torch God n/a 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Wall_of_Flesh_(Otherworldly).mp3 It's a dramatic and at times also heroic-sounding track. 88 Hallow (Otherworldly) Surface Hallow Otherworld 1.4.0.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Hallow_(Otherworldly).mp3 A track which features angelic, hymn-like female vocals followed by calm piano music. It's the only in-game Otherworld track longer than 2 minutes. 89 Journey's End During the credits Vol. 4 1.4.1 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Journey%27s_End.mp3 A heroic, celebratory track, fit for the theme heard just after beating The Moon Lord. 90 Deerclops Deerclops n/a 1.4.3 https://terraria.fandom.com/wiki/File:Music-Deerclops.mp3 This is the only track in the game not composed by Scott Lloyd Shelly - it is instead arranged by Klei Entertainment. It is an upbeat, electronic remix of "The E.F.S. Of Winter" from Don't Starve Together.
